Posts.Content: Hi, Tom here Was on here last year couldn't decide whether to go Brachy Seeds or Surgery Well, went down to FL (we winter there) they had no Da Vinci machines in Sebring BUT They had what looked like an excellent brachy program, rad dr came in from Orlando and I got brachy on 12/23/2014 All went well, didn't even need a catheter, seeds went in at 7:30 and was on the way home shortly after noon. 1st PSA done 4/6/15 showed 1.85 PSA TODAY, 6/28/15 a little over 6 mo out, I scored a 1.2!! I couldn't be happier, I think the seeds are doing/have done their job and did/doing it well Urination is a bit slow, can't take flomax (itch like hell) but I'm doing ok there Sex has yet to materalize, but shows signs of coming back, (I had ED before all this happened) I'm so stoked by my score that isn't even an issue with me right now. So on we go...I made the RIGHT decision for ME it would seem. If you're considering seeding this could be you as well I was a Gleason 6, (3+3) 32CM prostate, had a PSA of 10.4, and cancer near as they could tell was all contained in the prostate My calcium and cholesterol is great too It's good to be alive!
Posts.Title: BRACHY REPORT...6 Months Out

Posts.Content: Hi I'm Tom 60yo been dealing with PC for 3 years...first 2 were only 1 tumor 10% Gleason 6, urologist said watch it no need for treatment. Next year very little change Now 1 mo ago 3rd biopsy showed 3-4 tumors one of which has 66% compared to 10 last year. Another showed up 37% Gleason still a 6 and I'm a T1, cancer prpbably confined to prostate. But...it's spreading. I've heard good thingsd about brachy but haven't done a rad onc consult. My concerns are if I dick around 3-6 mos I could lose whatever chance I have of getting it all out now. My urologist is one of the best, done literally hundreds and hundreds of surgerys, been here since 1973. We will use the "Gold Standard". I'm scheduled for surgery in 3 weeks. I know it's a bit more with cath, etc etc but I'll know quickly if all is well is the upside. Should I screw around or get it done? Any opinions/ideas would help. My biopsy from July 30 is below http://www.timemachinewatch.com/185/biopsy2014.JPG
Posts.Title: Brachy or Open Surgery? My Dilemma

Posts.Content: Hey, thanks for all your input! I may talk to a rad onc next week, just to be sure but at this point I'm leaning towards the open surgery. We DO have robotic available to us here but my Dr doesn't do it. I do know he is the most experienced in this area, and I wouldn't know who is doing the robotic. Maybe open will be a bit more painful, but I'm pretty confident I'll come out ok. Also, on open surgery he doesn't go thru the peritoneal cavity...the robot does. I just feel better knowing a competant surgeon with 30+ years of experience is handling it. And, as the Mod says, I really dont want to waste any more time. I'll post my decision and the outcome when I know it. I appreciate all the input i can get.
Posts.Title: Brachy or Open Surgery? My Dilemma

Posts.Content: 3mm of tumour invasion into bladder neck noted. Will monitor psa for now This is what has me worried whether open or robotic. You go thru all that and cancer STILL persists, then you have to have radiation anyway. My neighbor had open surgery, 3 yrs cancer free, now has same as you, going for rad therapy Maybe the seeds will eradicate it and I'll be done? I'll give the Rad Onc a listen...

Posts.Title: Brachy or Open Surgery? My Dilemma

Posts.Content: No robotic surgery for me...that option is OUT You hear just as many stories with complications with it as you do open. I'm gonna look into Brachy next week, just to get a 2nd opinion it may well be a viable option Got to do something next month tho regardless

Posts.Title: Brachy or Open Surgery? My Dilemma

Posts.Content: Hi All! Had Brachy in Dec 2014 now nearing end of Sept 2016 almost 21 months PSA has been holding steady at 1.0-1.2 Urination still troublesome but only up once each night and some nights not at all I am regulating Cialis and it actually WORKS (sometimes) Had 2 friends that had surgery have their cancer reappear one is not good. For me, so far...I am glad I chose the Brachy option, hope to have 15+ trouble free years ahead like some have had Glad to see everybody here hope all is ok, we are hangin in there! Tom
Posts.Title: 18+ Months Out...All Still Good!
